body_html:
Hi @mkalininait Thanks for the file. Very useful!
It leads to the following questions.

  • It looks useful for the students to see the csv's City and Country fields in the Teams app table (instead of the venue, as it is currently showing.) Okay?
  • Do the students need to see the csv's Region as well? Or is that only in use for orga's.
  • I made it so that every import updates the conferences that are already in the table. That means that you can make changes in the Google Doc, and only the changes (including new conferences) will be added to the table. (Because you won't be able to edit the conferences in the table.) Okay?

And two requests, because that would speed this issue up:

  • Do you need the year in the name column in Google Docs or can the year be in a separate column (preferably named season)?
  • Is it possible that you use 2 columns in Google Docs for the dates: start_date and end_date (and make them date-fields as well?

Thanks!

  I made it so that every import updates the conferences that are already in the table. That means that you can make changes in the Google Doc, and only the changes (including new conferences) will be added to the table. (Because you won't be able to edit the conferences in the table.) Okay?

And two requests, because that would speed this issue up:

 Is it possible that you use 2 columns in Google Docs for the dates: start_date and end_date (and make them date-fields as well?

Thanks!
body:
Hi @mkalininait Thanks for the file. Very useful!
It leads to the following questions.
- [x] It looks useful for the students to see the csv's City and Country fields in the Teams app table (instead of the venue, as it is currently showing.) Okay?
- [x] Do the students need to see the csv's Region as well? Or is that only in use for orga's.
- [x]  I made it so that every import updates the conferences that are already in the table. That means that you can make changes in the Google Doc, and only the changes (including new conferences) will be added to the table. (Because you won't be able to edit the conferences in the table.) Okay?

And two requests, because that would speed this issue up:
- [x] Do you _need_ the year in the `name` column in Google Docs or can the year be in a separate column (preferably named `season`)?
- [x] Is it possible that you use 2 columns in Google Docs for the dates: `start_date` and `end_date` (and make them `date`-fields as well? 

Thanks!
